algorithm: The new algorithm calculates the scores for assigning an item to each bin based on the remaining capacity of each bin, the size of the item, a penalty factor, and a modified version of the cumulative sum of the remaining capacities among all bins. The modified version involves adding a constant value to the cumulative sum to avoid division by zero and improve performance. Additionally, the penalty factor takes into account the difference between the remaining capacity and a target capacity.
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item, bins):
    remaining_capacity = bins - item
    cumsum_capacity = np.cumsum(remaining_capacity)
    scaled_capacity = remaining_capacity / (cumsum_capacity + 1e-12)  # Adding a small constant value to avoid division by zero
    target_capacity = np.mean(bins) / np.sqrt(item)
    penalty_factor = np.where(remaining_capacity > target_capacity, 1, 0)
    scores = penalty_factor / scaled_capacity * np.where(remaining_capacity >= item, remaining_capacity / np.sqrt(item), 0)
    return scores
